name: Josh C. TOWNSEND v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, PENNSYLVANIA BOARD OF PROBATION AND PAROLE, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Townsend v. Commonwealth, Pennsylvania Board of Probation & Parole

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C. J., ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ.
parties: Josh C. TOWNSEND v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, PENNSYLVANIA BOARD OF PROBATION AND PAROLE, Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Arthur R. Thomas, Asst. Chief Counsel, Robert A. Greevy, Chief Counsel, Jay C. Waldman, Harrisburg, Exc. Asst, to the Governor, LeRoy S. Zimmerman, Atty. Gen., for appellant.
Daniel McGee, P. D., Bellefonte, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
446 A.2d 601
Josh C. TOWNSEND v. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, PENNSYLVANIA BOARD OF PROBATION AND PAROLE, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued May 19, 1982.
Decided June 17, 1982.
Arthur R. Thomas, Asst. Chief Counsel, Robert A. Greevy, Chief Counsel, Jay C. Waldman, Harrisburg, Exc. Asst, to the Governor, LeRoy S. Zimmerman, Atty. Gen., for appellant.
Daniel McGee, P. D., Bellefonte, for appellee.
Before O’BRIEN, C. J., ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ.
